Annotation.note:
Show that the parallel to the side $BC$ through the vertex $A$ of $ABC$, the perpendicular from the circumcenter $O$ upon the symmedian issued from $A$, and the perpendicular upon $AO$ from the point of intersection $T$ of the tangents to the circumcircle at $B$ and $C$ are three concurrent lines.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
